Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: react-native
Description: Command line tools that ship with react-native in form of the @react-native-community/cli package

Arguments.Name: doctor
Arguments.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Diagnose and fix common Node.js, iOS, Android & React Native issues

Arguments.Name: --fix
Arguments.Description: Attempt to fix all diagnosed issues

Arguments.Name: --contributor
Arguments.Description: Add healthchecks required to installations required for contributing to React Native

Arguments.Name: bundle
Arguments.Description: Builds the javascript bundle for offline use

Arguments.Name: --entry-file
Arguments.Description: Path to the root JS file, either absolute or relative to JS root

Arguments.Name: --transformer
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom transformer to be used

Arguments.Name: --dev
Arguments.Description: If false, warnings are disabled and the bundle is minified (default: true)

Arguments.Name: --minify
Arguments.Description: Allows overriding whether bundle is minified. This defaults to false if dev is true, and true if dev is false. Disabling minification can be useful for speeding up production builds for testing purposes

Arguments.Name: --bundle-output
Arguments.Description: File name where to store the resulting bundle, ex. /tmp/groups.bundle

Arguments.Name: --bundle-encoding
Arguments.Description: Encoding the bundle should be written in (https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#buffer_buffer). (default: "utf8")

Arguments.Name: --max-workers
Arguments.Description: Specifies the maximum number of workers the worker-pool will spawn for transforming files. This defaults to the number of the cores available on your machine

Arguments.Name: --sourcemap-output
Arguments.Description: File name where to store the sourcemap file for resulting bundle, ex. /tmp/groups.map

Arguments.Name: --sourcemap-sources-root
Arguments.Description: Path to make sourcemap's sources entries relative to, ex. /root/dir

Arguments.Name: --sourcemap-use-absolute-path
Arguments.Description: Report SourceMapURL using its full path

Arguments.Name: --assets-dest
Arguments.Description: Directory name where to store assets referenced in the bundle

Arguments.Name: --unstable-transform-profile
Arguments.Description: Experimental, transform JS for a specific JS engine. Currently supported: hermes, hermes-canary, default

Arguments.Name: --read-global-cache
Arguments.Description: Try to fetch transformed JS code from the global cache, if configured

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Path to the CLI configuration file

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initialize a new React Native project named <projectName> in a directory of the same name

Arguments.Name: --template
Arguments.Description: Uses a custom template. Valid arguments are the ones supported by `yarn add [package]` or `npm install [package]`, if you are using `--npm` option

Arguments.Name: --directory
Arguments.Description: Uses a custom directory instead of `<projectName>`

Arguments.Name: --title
Arguments.Description: Uses a custom app title name for application

Arguments.Name: --port
Arguments.Description: Port on which to listen to

Arguments.Name: --projectRoot
Arguments.Description: Path to a custom project root

Arguments.Name: --watchFolders
Arguments.Description: Specify any additional folders to be added to the watch list

Arguments.Name: --assetPlugins
Arguments.Description: Specify any additional asset plugins to be used by the packager by full filepath

Arguments.Name: --sourceExts
Arguments.Description: Specify any additional source extensions to be used by the packager

Arguments.Name: --max-workers
Arguments.Description: Specifies the maximum number of workers the worker-pool will spawn for transforming files. This defaults to the number of the cores available on your machine

Arguments.Name: --transformer
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom transformer to be used

Arguments.Name: --custom-log-reporter-path
Arguments.Description: Path to a JavaScript file that exports a log reporter as a replacement for TerminalReporter

Arguments.Name: --https
Arguments.Description: Enables https connections to the server

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Path to the CLI configuration file

Arguments.Name: ram-bundle
Arguments.Description: Builds javascript as a "Random Access Module" bundle for offline use

Arguments.Name: --entry-file
Arguments.Description: Path to the root JS file, either absolute or relative to JS root

Arguments.Name: --transformer
Arguments.Description: Specify a custom transformer to be used

Arguments.Name: --dev
Arguments.Description: If false, warnings are disabled and the bundle is minified (default: true)

Arguments.Name: --minify
Arguments.Description: Allows overriding whether bundle is minified. This defaults to false if dev is true, and true if dev is false. Disabling minification can be useful for speeding up production builds for testing purposes

Arguments.Name: --bundle-output
Arguments.Description: File name where to store the resulting bundle, ex. /tmp/groups.bundle

Arguments.Name: --bundle-encoding
Arguments.Description: Encoding the bundle should be written in (https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#buffer_buffer). (default: "utf8")

Arguments.Name: --max-workers
Arguments.Description: Specifies the maximum number of workers the worker-pool will spawn for transforming files. This defaults to the number of the cores available on your machine

Arguments.Name: --sourcemap-output
Arguments.Description: File name where to store the sourcemap file for resulting bundle, ex. /tmp/groups.map

Arguments.Name: --sourcemap-sources-root
Arguments.Description: Path to make sourcemap's sources entries relative to, ex. /root/dir

Arguments.Name: --sourcemap-use-absolute-path
Arguments.Description: Report SourceMapURL using its full path

Arguments.Name: --assets-dest
Arguments.Description: Directory name where to store assets referenced in the bundle

Arguments.Name: --unstable-transform-profile
Arguments.Description: Experimental, transform JS for a specific JS engine. Currently supported: hermes, hermes-canary, default

Arguments.Name: --read-global-cache
Arguments.Description: Try to fetch transformed JS code from the global cache, if configured

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Path to the CLI configuration file

Arguments.Name: --indexed-ram-bundle
Arguments.Description: Force the "Indexed RAM" bundle file format, even when building for android

Arguments.Name: link
Arguments.Description: Links assets and optionally native modules

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Link all native modules and assets

Arguments.Name: upgrade
Arguments.Description: Upgrade your app's template files to the specified or latest npm version using `rn-diff-purge` project. Only valid semver versions are allowed

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Get relevant version info about OS, toolchain and libraries

Arguments.Name: profile-hermes
Arguments.Description: Pull and convert a Hermes tracing profile to Chrome tracing profile, then store it in the directory <destinationDir> of the local machine

Arguments.Name: --filename
Arguments.Description: File name of the profile to be downloaded, eg. sampling-profiler-trace8593107139682635366.cpuprofile

Arguments.Name: --raw
Arguments.Description: Pulls the original Hermes tracing profile without any transformation

Arguments.Name: --sourcemap-path
Arguments.Description: The local path to your source map file, eg. /tmp/sourcemap.json

Arguments.Name: --generate-sourcemap
Arguments.Description: Generates the JS bundle and source map

Arguments.Name: run-android
Arguments.Description: Builds your app and starts it on a connected Android emulator or device

Arguments.Name: --root
Arguments.Description: [DEPRECATED - root is discovered automatically] Override the root directory for the android build (which contains the android directory) (default: "")

Arguments.Name: --appFolder
Arguments.Description: [DEPRECATED – use "project.android.appName" in react-native.config.js] Specify a different application folder name for the android source. If not, we assume is "app"

Arguments.Name: --appId
Arguments.Description: Specify an applicationId to launch after build. If not specified, `package` from AndroidManifest.xml will be used. (default: "")

Arguments.Name: --appIdSuffix
Arguments.Description: Specify an applicationIdSuffix to launch after build. (default: "")

Arguments.Name: --main-activity
Arguments.Description: Name of the activity to start (default: "MainActivity")

Arguments.Name: --deviceId
Arguments.Description: Builds your app and starts it on a specific device/simulator with the given device id (listed by running "adb devices" on the command line)

Arguments.Name: --no-packager
Arguments.Description: Do not launch packager while building

Arguments.Name: --terminal
Arguments.Description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path. (default: "Apple_Terminal")

Arguments.Name: --tasks
Arguments.Description: Run custom Gradle tasks. By default it's "installDebug"

Arguments.Name: --no-jetifier
Arguments.Description: Do not run "jetifier" – the AndroidX transition tool. By default it runs before Gradle to ease working with libraries that don't support AndroidX yet. See more at: https://www.npmjs.com/package/jetifier

Arguments.Name: run-ios
Arguments.Description: Builds your app and starts it on iOS simulator

Arguments.Name: --simulator
Arguments.Description: Explicitly set simulator to use. Optionally include iOS version between parenthesis at the end to match an exact version: "iPhone 6 (10.0)" (default: "iPhone 12")

Arguments.Name: --configuration
Arguments.Description: Explicitly set the scheme configuration to use (default: "Debug")

Arguments.Name: --scheme
Arguments.Description: Explicitly set Xcode scheme to use

Arguments.Name: --project-path
Arguments.Description: Path relative to project root where the Xcode project (.xcodeproj) lives. (default: "ios")

Arguments.Name: --device
Arguments.Description: Explicitly set device to use by name

Arguments.Name: --udid
Arguments.Description: Explicitly set device to use by udid

Arguments.Name: --no-packager
Arguments.Description: Do not launch packager while building

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Do not use xcpretty even if installed

Arguments.Name: --terminal
Arguments.Description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path. (default: "Apple_Terminal")
